article.headline: Southern Miss 77, Tennessee-Martin 67
article.story: HATTIESBURG, Miss. (AP) -- Freshmen guards Jeremy Wise and Jarvis Hill scored 20 points each as Southern Miss held off Tennessee-Martin 77-67 on Thursday night. Hill tallied all of his 20 points in the second half as the Golden Eagles (2-0) overcame a one-point halftime deficit to earn the win. McClennon Tolliver scored 11 of his 16 points in the first half as the Skyhawks (1-3) battled to a 35-34 halftime advantage. Wise had 11 of his 20 points in the first half for Southern Miss to help keep the Golden Eagles within striking distance. Wise also led the Golden Eagles in scoring with 14 points in their first win of the year over Belhaven. Craig Craft added 11 for Southern Miss and Sai'Quon Stone had 10. For the Skyhawks, Cleve Woodfork added 12. Tennessee-Martin's Will Lewis had a game-high nine rebounds.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
